perturbation.original_text: JSC NOC KazakhOil, hereinafter referred to as the "Company", in the person of Executive Marketing Director Ms. A. M. Rakhimbekov, acting on the basis of the Power of Attorney (1) 1-13 dated January 3, 2000, on the one side and JSC Karakudukmunay, hereinafter referred to as the "Principal" in the person of General Director Mr. N. D. Klinchev and Financial Director Mr. R. Moore, acting on the basis of the Charter, on the other side, collectively referred to as the "Parties", have entered into this Transportation Contract (the "Contract") and hereby agree as follows:
perturbation.changed_text: JSC NOC KazakhOil, hereinafter referred to as the "Service Provider", in the person of Executive Marketing Director Ms. A. M. Rakhimbekov, acting on the basis of the Power of Attorney (1) 1-13 dated January 3, 2000, on the one side and JSC Karakudukmunay, hereinafter referred to as the "Principal" in the person of General Director Mr. N. D. Klinchev and Financial Director Mr. R. Moore, acting on the basis of the Charter, on the other side, collectively referred to as the "Parties", have entered into this Transportation Contract (the "Contract") and hereby agree as follows:
perturbation.explanation: The term 'Company' is changed to 'Service Provider' in the preamble but is not consistently updated throughout the contract. This will lead to confusion about which entity the contract refers to in subsequent clauses referencing 'Company'.

perturbation.original_text:
4.1  At all times during the term of this Contract, the Company shall:



(i)  Assist in obtaining required&sbsp;official export permissions (certificate of      origin of the Commodity at place the load output, customs declaration on      Commodity output) for release of the batch of Commodity being delivered      from the customs territory of the Republic of Kazakhstan;
perturbation.changed_text:
4.1  At all times during the term of this Contract, the Logistics Coordinator shall:



(i)  Assist in obtaining required&sbsp;official export permissions (certificate of      origin of the Commodity at place the load output, customs declaration on      Commodity output) for release of the batch of Commodity being delivered      from the customs territory of the Republic of Kazakhstan;
perturbation.explanation: In this section, 'Company' is replaced with 'Logistics Coordinator,' while it was redefined as 'Service Provider' in the preamble. This creates confusion over who is responsible for the stated obligations. The document fails to define whether 'Logistics Coordinator' and 'Service Provider' are the same.

perturbation.original_text:
5.1  The Principal shall pay the Company a fee of $1.00 (one dollar), inclusive      of VAT, per one net tonne of Commodity shipped pursuant to this Contract.

5.2  The Principal shall pay the commission fee for each delivered batch of      Commodity to the Company's account within 30 (thirty) banking days after      the Delivery Date.
perturbation.changed_text:
5.1  The Principal shall pay the Transportation Provider a fee of $1.00 (one dollar), inclusive      of VAT, per one net tonne of Commodity shipped pursuant to this Contract.

5.2  The Principal shall pay the commission fee for each delivered batch of      Commodity to the Service Provider's account within 30 (thirty) banking days after      the Delivery Date.
perturbation.explanation: Here, 'Company' is changed to 'Transportation Provider' in section 5.1, but remains 'Service Provider' in section 5.2 which was introduced in the preamble, thus creating an internal contradiction on which entity gets paid the fee. The document fails to define whether 'Transportation Provider' and 'Service Provider' are the same.
